intro:
A self styled internet pig. Oink.

* * *

[RekZone - My Blog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/13Ft1LPPqh7uDvhdB2JALPo1E73kKztB1E/)

post.body: So hello to anyone who takes the time to look at this. Hope it finds you well. Just taking a stroll through ZeroNet to see what I find. Very interested in looking closer at the decentralized web and what it could mean for the future of the internet.

Ok, about ready to strangle this thing. For the life of me I cannot get the port to open. I'm getting update and peer errors in almost every update, yet inexplicably some go through. 

Also I thought ZeroNet was supposed to automatically add the port to the forwarding list via upnp, but my router says it didn't even try.

Also I initially was going to run ZeroNet through strictly through tor, but you can't host through it so I'm kinda at a loss as to how that works in a P2P network setup. Too much reading, and configuration for 3 in the morning.
Finally got the stupid ISP router to let the port open. WOOT
🤔 Just curious if Zero was designed with extended unicode in mind. Mind you I see tons of chinese all over Zero so I'm guess it is but let's try.
So is there a branch of ZeroHome that lets you star sites in the connected sites list or provide some way of hiding part of the list? I've only been on here a day and the list is quite a scroll. 😐
Slowly but surely things are coming along. Need to work towards getting a few things ironed out with a few sites.

comment.body: @Rythyrix: Very true, then again the entire internet backbone right now is an open book for anyone wanting to make a buck. The thing that pisses me off most is that my ISP (Spectrum) router is broadcasting a company hotspot that I can't turn off. They are ripping me off for the crappy service they provide (1 whole Mbit up for only $80/mo), on top of degrading my service to provide a wifi network which I can't even use cause I don't pay for it. I would kill for choice.
@Jayofthezero: There is just so much locked out on it, and half the time any settings I change from the control panel just revert or won't save. :-(

@Nekololi: The router/modem combo box is required. I'm sure there is some legally required option of buying your own but when I asked they wouldn't tell me only saying that they don't provide support or information on it. I'm moving in a few months to a FIOS area and will be totally enjoying that async love. Still expensive but at least the service is actually decent.
@Nekololi: That's the thing. So long as it's not bad I don't want to make it unavailable or not seed it, just not clutter my list up. >.<
Oh, didn't notice the favorite. Thanks for that. Much better.
@Nekololi: Well seeding is the reason I wanted to get the port open. I wanted to maximize what I could give back. I don't use the tor mode though I experimented with it at first.
@Lmath: I know most ISP's use that tech to lock down the heavily abused ports like 25 for SMTP, and 80 to prevent you from hosting a website.
@Nekololi: Seeding does work, but it's like torrents. Its slower since you can only actively push out the content rather than accepting incoming requests.
